dtliExcerpt: Duncan Sheik's new musical 'Grey House' is a haunting, atmospheric thriller that succeeds in creating genuine chills, even if its narrative occasionally loses its way in the fog of its own ambitions.
bwwExcerpt: But apart from Laurie Metcalf’s enjoyable portrayal of an inscrutable mountain woman, and a set by Scott Pask out of the Grimms’ grimmest fairy tale, the play itself exists in a sort of gray zone — neither particularly terrifying nor profound. It belongs in that lesser rank of thrillers that whip up...
